dct_description_sm: Issued, May 1888, F.M. Thorn, Superintendent. Verified: B.A. Colonna, Assistant in charge of Office ; [Triangulation, Topography, and Hydrography] by C. Rockwell, Assistant ; Astronomical observations by G. Davidson, Assistant ; Magnetic Observations by G. Davidson, J.S. Lawson, E. Smith, and W.H. Dall, Assistants ; Verification of Hydrography by Lieut. Comdr. W.H. Brownson, U.S.N. Inspector of Hydrography ; The reduced drawing of Topography by H. Lindenkohl ; ...of Hydrography by A. Lindenkohl ; Topography and Sand [engraving] by H.C. Evans. General Lettering by A. Petersen and F. Courtenay. Title and Notes by H.M. Knight.
Depths shown by soundings and gradient shading (in low water areas); relief by contours and spot heights
Bar scales in statute miles, nautical miles, kilometers
Buoy legend, explanatory notes, latitude and longitude of Portland (Astronomical station Balch), River Lights table
Shows waterways, vegetation, islands, railroads, various buildings, topography, divisions of land, Portland city plan, "Oregon Railway & Nav. Co Shops & Grounds"
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Map Collections courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact Branner Earth Sciences Library & Map Collections at brannerlibrary@stanford.edu.
